activities.loc: Br 3 - Law Enforcement Center - North Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kamron D Windham

records.addlTxt:
8:49 AM Defendant Kamron D Windham in court.  Prosecuting attorney Jacob Nelson Garman in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 
Matter scheduled as a status conference. 
Defendant indicates he has not gone to the public defender's office because he does not know where it is. 
State puts offer on the record. 
BTC: Matter set over.
Status conference scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on December 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons.

2:40 PM Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Tanck-Adams in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kamron D Windham in court. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.
Status conference scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on October 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Initial appearance on August 23, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
